cluster_relations.rel_desc: Constrained relative movement within a metallic component contributes to the occurrence of cracking.
cluster_relations.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that the subject condition or mechanism promotes or contributes causally to the occurrence of the object failure mode, without implying strict sufficiency or necessity.

qualifiers.OtherQualifier: FailureContext: thermal fatigue cracking sites are associated with constrained relative movement

remarks: Relation chosen to capture that constrained relative movement is a condition promoting cracking.
Relation chosen to capture that constrained relative movement is a condition promoting cracking.

cluster_relations.rel_desc: Constrained differential expansion in a metallic component promotes the occurrence of cracking.
cluster_relations.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that the subject condition or mechanism promotes or contributes causally to the occurrence of the object failure mode, without implying strict sufficiency or necessity.

qualifiers.OtherQualifier: MechanismContext: constrained differential expansion generates local stresses leading to cracking

remarks: Relation primarily introduced to encode constrained differential expansion as a cracking condition.
Relation primarily introduced to encode constrained differential expansion as a cracking condition.
